dataIdInfo.idAbs:
This script exports a Feature Class containing spatially referenced genetic data into the text file format required by GenAlEx (Peakall and Smouse 2006), an MS Excel Add-In created to run various genetic analyses in Excel.

GenAlEx is freely available from: http://www.anu.edu.au/BoZo/GenAlEx/

Required Inputs:

  • An exisitng Feature Class with spatially referenced genetic data and targeted for addtional analysis in GenAlEx

  • An Output File Location where the text file will be written

  • An Output File Name for the text file

Optional Inputs:

  • Where Clause that can be used to select only those records wth genetic data from the Feature Class.

    NOTE: This parameter is optional and is included because some data sets may have individual IDs based on more than genetics (i.e., photo-ID). If your data has only genetic records, this parameter can be left blank.

  • Attribute Field that can be used to distinguish between populationa in the Input Feature Class.

    NOTE: The parameter is optional and is included because some data sets may have more than one population

  • Outputs:

  • A comma delimited text file formatted to match the required input for GenAlEx

Consts.useLimit: • This script was developed to work with ArcGIS 10.1 and Python 2.7 installed during ArcGIS installation.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Created by the geneGIS team: Dori Dick, Shaun Walbridge, Scott Baker, Dawn Wright

tool.name: ExportGenAlEx

param.name: Input_Feature_Class
param.dialogReference: Select a Feature Class containing spatially reference genetic data.

param.name: Where_Clause
param.dialogReference: If the feature class contains spatially referenced data that is not genetic, the Where Clause can be used to select only those records with genetic data.

param.name: Attribute_Field_to_order_by_population_
param.dialogReference:
Select the Attribute Field to differentiate between the different populations in the Input Feature Class. This step is optional depending on the data in the Input Feature Class.

If the data comes from only 1 population, this step can be skipped.

param.name: Output_File
param.dialogReference: The file path and name of the Output Text File.

tool.summary:
This script exports a Feature Class containing spatially referenced genetic data into the text file format required by GenAlEx (Peakall and Smouse 2006), an MS Excel Add-In created to run various genetic analyses in Excel.

GenAlEx is freely available from: http://www.anu.edu.au/BoZo/GenAlEx/

Required Inputs:

  • An exisitng Feature Class with spatially referenced genetic data and targeted for addtional analysis in GenAlEx

  • An Output File Location where the text file will be written

  • An Output File Name for the text file

Optional Inputs:

  • Where Clause that can be used to select only those records wth genetic data from the Feature Class.

    NOTE: This parameter is optional and is included because some data sets may have individual IDs based on more than genetics (i.e., photo-ID). If your data has only genetic records, this parameter can be left blank.

  • Attribute Field that can be used to distinguish between populationa in the Input Feature Class.

    NOTE: The parameter is optional and is included because some data sets may have more than one population

  • Outputs:

  • A comma delimited text file formatted to match the required input for GenAlEx
tool.usage: Exports spataily reference genetic data in a text file formatted for input into GenAlEx.
